intro: Guarea adenophylla, commonly known as the white-leaf guarea, is a tropical tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other hardwoods. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves that are usually light green in color. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically appearing in green or reddish bracts. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds.
